title: Emoti-Attack: Zero-Perturbation Adversarial Attacks on NLP Systems via Emoji Sequences
author: Yangshijie Zhang (Lanzhou University), ..., Haohe Liu (University of Surrey)
relevance_why: The paper introduces novel methods for adversarial attacks on NLP models which could inform techniques for audio-language models with adversarial robustness considerations.
background: This work investigates how emoji sequences can be manipulated to create adversarial text inputs that mislead NLP models without altering the original text.
contribution: Emoti-Attack introduces a method leveraging emoji sequences to create adversarial examples while preserving textual integrity, achieving effective attacks on both small and large NLP models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focused on character and word-level attacks that significantly altered meaning or were easily detectable.
technical_comparison.novelty: This new method minimizes perceptibility by utilizing emojis strategically, resulting in successful perturbations without changing the original text.

key_innovation: The unique approach of attacking models via emoji sequences allows nonsensical insertions that maintain semantic consistency with the primary text.
real_world_impact: Insights from this research could be useful for enhancing the robustness of various NLP applications, likely leading to more resilient conversational AI systems.
limitations: No limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Zero-Perturbation: **Zero-Perturbation** refers to the technique of causing model misclassification without altering the visible text content.
new_terms.Adversarial Attacks: **Adversarial Attacks** are techniques aimed at misleading machine learning models through deceptive input data to evaluate and enhance the models' robustness.
